intro: Didymocheton rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed sphaerocaryon, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its rough, reddish-brown stems and broad, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry to semi-deciduous forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
